definition.text: The Docs feature five different categories of pages. Node, Concept, Topic, Tutorial, and Review. Each of them is a collection of pages users may read.

paragraphs.text: For each Node defined within the Project, there is a Docs Node Page explaining what the Node is used for.
Concepts are notions that are not represented as nodes in the system. They are not ellaborate or deep enough to require a topic.
Topics are multi-faceted, deep concepts that require more than one page to be correctly addressed. Topics are sets of closely related concepts.
Tutorials are made of steps, and each step draws information from a tutorial step page in the Docs. Pages in a tutorial are arranged in a sequence.
Reviews are user-generated content describing their experience with certain components of Superalgos or other projects.
